intro: Anneslia minutifolia, commonly known as the dwarf anneslia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Anneslia minutifolia is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a container plant due to its compact size and ornamental appeal.
